intro: Hasseanthus elongatus, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a slightly hairy texture. Hasseanthus elongatus is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it adapts well to arid and semi-arid conditions.
